ygData.subject: Re: Suggested monk improvements
ygData.msgSnippet: And a good cleric at you side can make up for the hps with Symbol and Valor or resolution. Heldenfeld ... From:  To:
ygData.messageBody:
And a good cleric at you side can make up for the hps with Symbol and Valor
or resolution.

Heldenfeld

----- Original Message -----
From: <JnglSkyPWR@...>
To: <EQ-Monks@onelist.com>
Sent: Tuesday, September 07, 1999 12:38 PM
Subject: Re: [EQ-Monks] Suggested monk improvements


> From: JnglSkyPWR@...
>
> I may not be quite as high as you, but I do have friends that are lvls 47,
49
> and 50 monks and a lvl 50 magician. Monk BY FAR outdamage any other melee
> class. My lvl 50 magician has an earth elemental pet, and nobody can come
> close to outdamaging it other than a lvl 50 monk. The reason we don't
make
> great tanks is one, hit points. We don't get nearly as many as warrriors,
> but our AC is fairly close if we choose to wear AC type armor. I myself
> don't, I choose to go with stat increasing items, dex and agl. Right now
at
> lvl 40, I can outdamage any other melee class with very decent equipment.
I
> can hardly wait to get my sash and up past 45, I've seen what my friends
can
> do and it is amazing.
>
> Kanja Dragonfist
> 40th monk
> Rodcet Nife
>
